definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: The taste is aroused the suspicions of the veterans, but been boiled chicken from success.
sentences.chinese: 味道却引起老兵们的怀疑，却被白斩鸡成功瞒过。

sentences.english: Presented by the Chinese American veterans of the 14th Air Force.
sentences.chinese: 由第14航空队的中美老兵赠送。

sentences.english: A veteran should be entitled to special treatment because of his service in war.
sentences.chinese: 老兵因在战时服过役应享有特殊待遇。

sentences.english: Old Soldiers never die; they only fade away.
Four years later, the WWI vets received their bonuses.
sentences.chinese: 四年之后，一战老兵们领到了他们的补偿款。

sentences.english: Why is the Vietnam veteran and concerned about Agent Orange?
sentences.chinese: 为什么是越南老兵关注橙剂？

sentences.english: Veterans of the war were desperate for relief.
sentences.chinese: 一战老兵们走投无路，急需救济。

sentences.english: These were battle-tested vets , and they played like it.
sentences.chinese: 他们是久经沙场的老兵，他们就是这样打球。

sentences.english: While in Vietnam, I became a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, Post 1432, here in Salina.
sentences.chinese: 当在越南的时候，我成了海外战争的一名老兵。

sentences.english: "I don't have your worries, " quavered the veteran.
sentences.chinese: “我没有你那么多伤脑筋的事，”老兵颤抖抖地说。

sentences.english: The old soldiers urge me not to go looking.
Now he is, at 38, the grand old man of the N.B.A.
sentences.chinese: 今年，他已经38岁了，成了一位功勋卓著的老兵。

sentences.english: Encouraging his teammates, both the veterans and the yearlings.
sentences.chinese: 激励自己的队友，不管他们是老兵还是新秀。

sentences.english: Every day, we lose hundreds of vets of this period.
sentences.chinese: 每天，我们会失去许多这一时期参加越战的退役老兵。

sentences.english: He has levied heavily on the memory of the veterans in writing the history of the war.
sentences.chinese: 在编写战史时他从老兵们的回忆中获得了大量材料。

sentences.english: I am proud to be a veteran, along with many others.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个老兵，和其他人一样，我很自豪。

definition: to be discharged from military service
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to enlist/to serve in the army
